column1: Sergey Nikolayevich Ryazansky (Russian: ??????? ?????????? ?????????; born November 13, 1974) is a Russian cosmonaut.
He was selected as commander of the IMBP-6 cosmonaut group in 2003, but later transferred to the TsPK Cosmonaut Group.
Ryazansky is currently assigned to the Soyuz TMA-10M/Expedition 37/Expedition 38 mission which launched in September 2013 and scheduled to return in March 2014.
Ryazansky was born in Moscow, Soviet Union.
He is the grandson of Mikhail Ryazanskiy, chief Soviet guidance designer of the Sputnik era.
He attended Moscow State University and graduated as a biochemist in 1996.

column2: After college he began working as a researcher at the Institute of Biomedical Problems.

column1: He was selected as a research and test cosmonaut in 2003.

column2: In 2009 he participated in a 105 day mission as part of phase two of the Mars 500 program.

column1: He will serve as a Flight Engineer on Expedition 37 and Expedition 38 before returning to Earth aboard the Soyuz in March 2014.
He is divorced with one child.
